data.event: When the area was first settled by Europeans in 1832, the townsite and the river were named after Stratford-upon-Avon, England.

event.title: was incorporated as a town in 1859

data.event: Stratford was incorporated as a town in 1859 and as a city in 1886.
In 1933 a general strike, started by the furniture workers and led by the Communist Workers' Unity League, marked the last time the army was deployed to break a strike in Canada.
The city's economy took a major turn when the Stratford Shakespeare Festival started in 1953.

event.title: pitched by Tom Patterson while at the convention of the Canadian chapter of the American Waterworks Association in Winnipeg May 1951

data.event: Mayor David Simpson approved the project pitched by Tom Patterson while at the convention of the Canadian chapter of the American Waterworks Association in Winnipeg May 1951.
The annual festival now brings hundreds of thousands of theatre goers and tourists to the area.
